slide.lede: To understand "schemaless", begin with a relational schema

ul.li: The relational schema defines what columns appear in the table, their names, and their datatypes.
It is an error to insert data that doesn't fit the schema

slide.lede: A schemaless database allows you to store any data

ul.li: A schemaless database allows any data, structured with individual fields and structures, to be stored in the database.
Being schemaless reduces ceremony (you don't have to define schemas) and increases flexibility (you can store all sorts of data without prior definition)
